issue.message: WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE no longer provides write access when targeting Android 11+, even when using `requestLegacyExternalStorage`
Call requires API level 33 (current min is 23): `launchChangeAppLanguageIntent`
Attribute `appCategory` is only used in API level 26 and higher (current min is 23)
Attribute `localeConfig` is only used in API level 33 and higher (current min is 23)
Attribute `targetCellWidth` is only used in API level 31 and higher (current min is 23)
Attribute `targetCellHeight` is only used in API level 31 and higher (current min is 23)
The application should not provide its own launch screen
A newer version of com.android.tools:desugar_jdk_libs than 2.0.4 is available: 2.1.2
A newer version of org.jetbrains.kotlin.android than 1.9.21 is available: 1.9.25
A newer version of com.google.devtools.ksp than 1.9.21-1.0.16 is available: 1.9.25-1.0.20
A newer version of androidx.lifecycle:lifecycle-process than 2.7.0 is available: 2.8.6
A newer version of androidx.media3:media3-exoplayer than 1.2.1 is available: 1.4.1
A newer version of androidx.media3:media3-session than 1.2.1 is available: 1.4.1
A newer version of com.android.application than 8.2.2 is available: 8.6.1
Expecting `android:screenOrientation="unspecified"` or `"fullSensor"` for this activity so the user can use the application in any orientation and provide a great experience on Chrome OS devices
This declaration is opt-in and its usage should be marked with `@androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi` or `@OptIn(markerClass = androidx.media3.common.util.UnstableApi.class)`
Use `ResourcesCompat.getDrawable()`
Use `ResourcesCompat.getDrawable()`
Use `ResourcesCompat.getDrawable()`
Use `ResourcesCompat.getDrawable()`
